salvage.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to save something from an accident or bad situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost
salvage.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Divers hope to salvage some of the ship’s cargo.
They managed to salvage only a few of their belongings from the fire.
salvage.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make sure that you do not lose something completely, or to make sure that something does not fail completely
salvage.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He fought to salvage the company’s reputation.
salvage.translation[1].definitions[0].de: when you save things from a situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost
salvage.translation[1].definitions[1].de: things that have been saved from an accident, especially when a ship has sunk
salvage.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to save goods or property from a situation in which things have already been damaged or destroyed
salvage.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Unsuccessful attempts were made to salvage the ship immediately after it sank.
salvage.translation[2].definitions[1].de: if someone salvages a deal when there have been serious disagreements and problems about it, they find a way to make people accept it
salvage.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: He salvaged a last-minute deal to sell the state’s interests in the bank.
